text: bare metal brings infinite flexibility
unrivaled performance the ability to
switch architectures use armed devices i
think is a really great selling point
you know we've covered the network all
these things are great but you're right
in that running things in vms you have
kind of opaque problems and when you run
them on the metal those go away because
you have full visibility of everything
on the stack which is great however you
then have to operate bear metal and i
think this is still a really challenging
thing teams these days don't have
dedicated op teams anymore like they
used to when we had our own data centers
you know we're all devops and agile and
you know terraformed that we just don't
have that experience so you know you've
got to be careful when you're adopting
bare metal don't walk into it lightly
thinking i know a little bit of linux
this will be okay there's a lot to learn
there like you said even bgp how many
people can tell you what bgp is in 2021
right it's not that many anymore and why
would they because they've had
convenience at their doorstep for so
long so bare metal will remove a whole
class of problems like you've said but
it brings in different challenges that
you need to kind of navigate approach
wisely
[Music]
